subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: I have a question.
author: Carol B.
full_text:
I use Adobe Audition...99 per cent of the time the procedure I use to
"clean up" evp's is this...I amplify...then I will use the graphic
equalizer preset on vocal presence....occasionally I use the slow down...

This works really well for me....I'm just saying,
Carol B.









> The problem with it Jim is that there is no way to "clean" the audio
> without effecting the stuff you want to keep as well. At least not with
> the cheapy softwares. I head the Adobe Audition is much better at it, but
> still not perfect.
>
> But again, enhance all you want, just make sure you keep the original
> unaltered.
>
>   ----- Original Message -----
>   From: James W. Hyslope
>   To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
>   Sent: Tuesday, May 19, 2009 7:11 PM
>   Subject: [EVP-ITC] Re: I have a question.
>
>
>
>
>
>   Well, for myself...I don't "clean" them up to much because I really
> don't know HOW :) (well a little bit)Since I've only been at it for a
> couple weeks. BUT if you can clean up something to where you can FIND
> what was there to begin with "you have done no harm" I hear alot more
> than others I guess, and I haven't enhanced many of my evp's.*If anyone
> is able to clean them up...I DO promise you will hear what I say is
> correct)Pretty BOLD statement, but if you are able to clean it up with
> better software (please do for others too) I will be more than happy to
> "listen" where I made a mistake...I can only LEARN from it :) I have
> done some DEEP enhancements to a few of my evp's...from the begining I
> could only hear clicks and thumps.....but after messing with that area,
> eventually I would hear the true voices (and can tell if male or
> female...approximate age) and understand the mood also....these where
> extreamly modified, and I feel that I could NOT have added enough
> "simple" enhancements that would ADD a voice....full of emotion and
> distinct syllables :) And some just can't hear them for what ever reason
> be it equipment that is used to hear (pc-headphones-speakers-ears) know
> one has the perfect match of all these things. Check out "Jim's RR-DR60
> EVP's" in the files section....work them over till you hear them. I
> really can't do much more :)--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, Eric
> VanDuzer <evanduzer@...> wrote:
>   >
>   > Now I may be biased to the "investigation" way of doing things. I do
> clean
>   > up evps if I hear something and can't make it out do to ambient noise.
> So
>   > hear is my question. When do you stop cleaning up? Wouldn't to much
>   > enhancing "taint" the results? To me the more enhancing you do the
> less
>   > convincing it becomes. I hope noone finds this offensive, it is not
> meant
>   > to be I am just really curious. The way I look at it is that if you
> have to
>   > do so much enhancing to find anything, was there really something
> there to
>   > begin with. Are we just making ourselves believe there is something
> there??
>   >
>   > Eric
>   >
>
>
>
>
